references.title: UN right to water (Press release, 28 Jul 2020)
references.description: On 28 July 2010, the United Nations General Assembly explicitly recognized the human right to water and sanitation. The right to clean water and sanitation is a human right and is fundamental to human dignity.

references.title: Groundwater facts
references.description: Globally, 2.5 billion people depend on groundwater to satisfy their basic water needs. Groundwater supplies roughly half of the world's drinking water.

references.title: Private wells (American Housing Survey 2017)
references.description: More than 13 million households rely on private wells for drinking water in the United States. Unlike municipal water supplies, private wells are not regulated by the EPA.

references.title: Diamond Challenge Finalists 2025 — Lucent
references.description: Lucent: Affordable, 3D-printed well-water filter using regenerable ion exchange resin for safe, easy rural use.

references.title: WQA Fact Sheet: Nitrate/Nitrite (2014)
references.description: Nitrate was the most common inorganic contaminant derived from man-made sources found at concentrations greater than the Federal drinking water standard (10 mg/L) in private wells. More than 1 million private well owners are in areas with groundwater risk above the 10 mg/L MCL.

references.title: Potential well contaminants — nitrates
references.description: Nitrates can contaminate wells via fertilizer, sewage, animal waste. High levels cause methemoglobinemia ('blue baby syndrome') in infants.

references.title: USGS PFAS in wells study
references.description: USGS study detected PFAS in 20% of private wells tested. PFAS are linked to cancer, birth defects, thyroid disease, immune suppression, and more.

references.title: UV disinfection of drinking water
references.description: UV light is normally effective against all viruses, bacteria and protozoa when properly designed and maintained.

references.title: UV log reductions
references.description: UV destroys 99.99% of viruses and 99.9999% of bacteria, more effective than chlorine for many pathogens.

references.title: Nitrates in your water
references.description: Specialized anion exchange water softeners remove nitrates from well water. Periodic regeneration with salt brine flushes out nitrates and recharges the resin.

references.title: PFAS removal by anion exchange
references.description: Strong anion exchange resins are very promising for PFAS removal, with removal percentages up to 90–99% for acidic PFAS like PFOA/PFOS.

references.title: 3D-printed filtration systems (Kim et al., 2020)
references.description: 3D printing enables compact, customized filtration systems made from common plastics, suitable for on-site water treatment in rural areas.

references.title: Local 3D-printing for water tech
references.description: Because design files are stored digitally, communities around the world could print their own devices locally, eliminating the need for a centralized distribution system.
